intro: Hesperis hyrcanica, commonly known as the Hyrcanian hesperis, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant produces showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to temperate climates. Hesperis hyrcanica is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in its native habitat.
